summary: A Washington Post article reporting on Attorney General William Barr's public criticism of prison officials for failing to keep Jeffrey Epstein alive in custody, and his vow to investigate Epstein's co-conspirators. The article highlights the Justice Department's commitment to continuing the investigation despite Epstein's death.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Publicly criticized prison officials for failing to keep Jeffrey Epstein alive and vowed to investigate Epstein's co-conspirators.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The financier who died in prison while awaiting trial on sex trafficking charges.

connections.description: Barr, as Attorney General, is overseeing the investigation into Epstein and his co-conspirators following Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein's death in prison
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died while in prison custody, with the Attorney General criticizing officials for failing to keep him alive.

events.title: Barr's public statement
events.description: Attorney General William Barr publicly criticized prison officials and vowed to investigate Epstein's co-conspirators.

keyFacts: Attorney General William Barr publicly criticized prison officials for their failure to keep Jeffrey Epstein alive.
Barr vowed that the Justice Department would continue to investigate Epstein's co-conspirators.
The article confirms the Justice Department's commitment to pursuing the case despite Epstein's death.
